result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert S Rebholz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
4 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Deft is ordered to provide a DNA specimen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert S Rebholz in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.
Deft is ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$200+cc+DNA, pp $100/mo beg 11-1-15, ftp 4 days RCJ for contempt.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No VIOLENT contact with any persons.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Robert S Rebholz in court.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Attorney information given to defendant.
